visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart. The chart should display data from four series: country, region, income, and world. Each series should have a unique name and corresponding data points. The chart should have a title derived from the indicator name, a subtitle indicating the data source, and styled axes and labels. The tooltip should display the series name and data value with two decimal places. The chart should also have custom colors for the series and a background color.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a spline chart with multiple series representing different data categories such as country, region, income, and world. The chart is styled with a custom background color and specific colors for each series. The title and subtitle are styled with appropriate font sizes and colors. The x-axis is labeled with dates in reverse order to display the earliest date on the left, and the y-axis is labeled with values. The tooltip is formatted to display the series name and data value with two decimal places. The series data is reversed to match the chronological order of the dates. Overall, the chart is designed to provide a clear and visually appealing representation of the data sourced from the World Bank.
